name: Xi System Independant Package Manager
short_description:
Xi is a replacement for apt or yum allowing you to download and install packages from your local disk or from the web on your Un-/Linux machine for all users or just for you. 

These packages are .tar.gz files with all the information and dependencies Xi needs to prepare it for usage.
the ~/.xi.config file holds your configuration, while ~/.xi-repo/ contains your currant version and ~/.xi-bin the software installed without su permission.

Xi is written in Perl.
summary: A package manager for Unix-Like Systems without preferred platform.
